metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10167 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The virConnectGetDomainCapabilities() libvirt API, versions 4.x.x before 4.10.1 and 5.x.x before 5.4.1, accepts an "emulatorbin" argument to specify the program providing emulation for a domain. Since v1.2.19, libvirt will execute that program to probe the domain's capabilities. Read-only clients could specify an arbitrary path for this argument, causing libvirtd to execute a crafted executable with its own privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10167` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-bin - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-clients - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-daemon - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-sheepdog - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-daemon-system - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-sanlock - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-wireshark - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt0 - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12').
